title: Oleksandr Dovzhenko. The enchanted Desna (1982).pdf
description:
Dovzhenko was a famous Ukrainian writer and film director. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_Dovzhenko


Autobiographically inspired, The Enchanted Desna can be regarded as a story told from a young boyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s point of view. He recognizes lifeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s cycle and death amidst the natural beauty and plentiful bounty of nature Ã¢â‚¬â€ A certain mystery and sadness, the inevitability and law that out of what seemingly ends, come the pleasant things of this world. Throughout the journey, the reader is reminded of lifeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s delicate balance or as Sashko, the young boy, witnesses, the negative abundance of things: Riding a hay-filled wagon about to tip over is unpleasant. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s unpleasant to look at a large fire, but pleasant to look at its embers. How pleasant it is to hug a foal. Or at daybreak to see your calf wandering in all by itself, to know it found its way home in the dark. I loved thunder, although it scared Mother, the downpour and loud wind for the gifts they brought to the orchard.

Translated into English by Anatole Bilenko.
